title:
Incorporating Local Step-Size Adaptivity into the No-U-Turn Sampler
  using Gibbs Self Tuning
authors: Nawaf Bou-Rabee, Bob Carpenter, Tore Selland Kleppe, Milo Marsden
abstract:
Adapting the step size locally in the no-U-turn sampler (NUTS) is challenging
because the step-size and path-length tuning parameters are interdependent. The
determination of an optimal path length requires a predefined step size, while
the ideal step size must account for errors along the selected path. Ensuring
reversibility further complicates this tuning problem. In this paper, we
present a method for locally adapting the step size in NUTS that is an instance
of the Gibbs self-tuning (GIST) framework. Our approach guarantees
reversibility with an acceptance probability that depends exclusively on the
conditional distribution of the step size. We validate our step-size-adaptive
NUTS method on Neal's funnel density and a high-dimensional normal
distribution, demonstrating its effectiveness in challenging scenarios.
